subject: Critical issue: Critical infrastructure issue in redis-cache (eu-west-1)

messages.content:
Subject: Critical issue: Critical infrastructure issue in redis-cache (eu-west-1)

Automated detection from monitoring system:

The redis-cache service in the eu-west-1 region is experiencing critical resource constraints due to high CPU (93.67%) and memory (97.68%) utilization. This is likely caused by a surge in database queries, leading to performance degradation. Customers may experience increased latency and errors (500 status codes) when accessing the API, potentially resulting in service outages.

Service: redis-cache
Region: eu-west-1
Severity: critical
Event Type: infrastructure

Metrics:
{
  "cpu_percent": 93.67,
  "memory_percent": 97.68,
  "disk_io_mbps": 233.3,
  "network_io_mbps": 471.71
}

Workaround: Scale up the redis-cache service resources and investigate the database query patterns to optimize performance. Consider implementing rate limiting on API calls to reduce load.

This ticket was auto-generated by the AI monitoring system.

extracted_fields.requested_action: Scale up the redis-cache service resources and investigate the database query patterns.

current_triage.rationale: The ticket describes a critical infrastructure issue causing performance degradation and potential service outages, which necessitates immediate action.

current_routing.reasoning: Routed to engineering due to outage classification. SLA set based on enterprise tier and P0 priority. Escalated due to P0 critical priority.
